channel.title: oscon2004 on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in oscon2004 on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: OSCON Day 5: Maps as Culture
item.description: Today is the last day of OSCON, and the conference will be over at noon today.

item.title: The Lure of the Unknown
item.description: Warning: I just re-read this post and it’s a little rambling…but I’m too tired to re-write it, so take it for what it’s worth.

item.title: Building for Windows
item.description: It’s a little ironic that the best session I attended yesterday was presented by a Microsoft employee, Rob Mensching .

item.title: OSCON Day 1 Keynotes
item.description: Today is the opening day of the Open Source Conference.

item.title: It’s just buttons and stickers, people!
item.description: Those of us at CC are encouraged to blog our public (or semi-public) appearances, and I so I dutifully posted my attendance at OSCON this week.

item.title: Hello, Portland
item.description: I arrived in Portland on Saturday night and in the 48 hours since have fallen in love with the MAX .
